org.rakiura.cpn
Class Transition

java.lang.Object
  org.rakiura.cpn.Node
      org.rakiura.cpn.Transition
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, PlaceListener, NetElement
public class Transition
extends Node
implements PlaceListener

Represents a transition in JFern Petri net model. This class implements a simple transition, and the behaviour can be overwritten by custom subclasses.
The input and output arcs are stored in HashSet containers.

Transition.java
Created: Mon Sep 25 19:45:05 2000

Constructor Detail

Transition

public Transition()
Creates a new BasicTransition instance. Name and ID are set to a new unique ID.

Transition

public Transition(java.lang.String aName)
Creates a new BasicTransition instance. It will give the transition a new unique ID as well.

Parameters:
aName - a String value
Method Detail

addInput

public Transition addInput(InputArc anArc)
Adds an input Arc. This method is not for the user to call directly, it is called by newly created arcs which plug themselves automatically to the appropriate transitions. The transition will register itself as a placelisterner to the arc's place.

Parameters:
anArc - the input arc to add to the transition
Returns:
this Transition.
See Also:
removeInput(org.rakiura.cpn.InputArc)

removeInput

public Transition removeInput(InputArc anArc)
Removes an input Arc. This method is not for the user to call directly, it is called by arcs which unplug themselves automatically from the appropriate transitions. The transition removes itself as placelistener from the arc's place.

Parameters:
anArc - the arc to remove.
Returns:
this Transition.
See Also:
addInput(InputArc)

addOutput

public Transition addOutput(OutputArc anArc)

Parameters:
anArc - the output arc to add.
Returns:
this Transition.
See Also:
removeOutput(org.rakiura.cpn.OutputArc)

removeOutput

public Transition removeOutput(OutputArc anArc)

Parameters:
anArc - the arc to remove from the transition
Returns:
this Transition.

setTypeText

public void setTypeText(java.lang.String type)
Sets the type description of this transition. Example: control, task, ..
The setting of the type has no effect on the transition, but proper use allows the user to use it for analysis etc. without having to interpret the java code.

Parameters:
type - the type

getTypeText

public java.lang.String getTypeText()
Returns the type description of this transition. Example: routing, task, ...

Returns:
the type
See Also:
setTypeText(String)

setSpecificationText

public void setSpecificationText(java.lang.String specification)
Sets the specification text of the type. Examples: AND-split, OR-SPLIT, 'taksname', ... The setting of this descriptive text has no influence on the behaviour of the transition, but if used properly, it can help in analysis etc.

Parameters:
specification - the specification text.
See Also:
setTypeText(java.lang.String)

getSpecificationText

public java.lang.String getSpecificationText()
returns the specification text of the type. Examples: AND-split, OR-SPLIT, 'taksname', ...

Returns:
the specification text
See Also:
getTypeText(), getSpecificationText()

fire

public Transition fire()
Fires this transition and executes an action code. Same as fire(true).

Returns:
this Transition
See Also:
fire(boolean)

fire

public Transition fire(boolean withAction)
Fire this transition. If this transition is enabled, the tokens will be taken from input places according to the current binding, action will be executed, and tokens will be placed into output places according to the binding.

Parameters:
withAction - if true action code will be executed, if false action code execution will be skipped.
Returns:
this Transition
Since:
3.0

addTransitionListener

public void addTransitionListener(TransitionListener aListener)
Registers a given TransitionListener with this place.

Parameters:
aListener - a TransitionListener to be registered with this Transition.
Since:
2.0

Since:
2.0

notify

public void notify(PlaceEvent anEvent)
Description copied from interface: PlaceListener
Notifies the listener that the marking of the place has changed. It may be caused by either adding or removing a token from a Place.

Specified by:
notify in interface PlaceListener
Parameters:
anEvent - a PlaceEvent value

notify

public void notify(TokensRemovedEvent anEvent)
Description copied from interface: PlaceListener
Notifies the listener that the marking of the place has changed. It is fired when tokens are removed from the place.

Specified by:
notify in interface PlaceListener
Parameters:
anEvent - a TokensRemovedEvent value
